page.title: 032ND SCHOOL ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: When we go to Secondary school we have to stay in a hostel from Monday to Friday,because it is on the main island.The children go to St.Mary's on a boat on Monday mornings at a quarter to eight and then they come back at quarter past four on Friday afternoons.Sometimes in the winter the children have to travel in oil skins because the sea gets very rough and stormy.The Comprehensive school on the main island only caters for children up to the age of sixteen where they can do their O'Levels.They then transfer to a Sixth Form College in Cornwall if they want to continue their education.Some attend a boarding school,others stay in lodgings.When the students leave Sixth Form College some of them go on to have further education at colleges or universities in different parts of the country.
